philipm.cs5.software.development.server.system

Class Fixture

  • java.lang.Object
    • philipm.cs5.software.development.server.system.Fixture

  • public class Fixture
extends java.lang.Object
    This static class is used to interact with the fixture and results stored.
    Author:
    mortimer

    • Method Detail

      • createdNewFixturesFromStart

        public static void createdNewFixturesFromStart(java.lang.String[] players)
                                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Creates a new set of fixtures from scratch with the status of not having been played
        Parameters:
        players - The name of all players. They must all be unique.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - An exception if the fixtures can't be generated due to player size

      • writeToFile

        public static void writeToFile(java.lang.String[][][] fixtures,
                               java.lang.String[] nameOfPlayersAddedLate)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the fixtures list to the file.
        Parameters:
        fixtures - The fixtures array to write
        nameOfPlayersAddedLate - The players added halfway through the season
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - An IOException may occur when writing to file

      • getListOfPeopleToAddedDuringSeason

        public static java.lang.String[] getListOfPeopleToAddedDuringSeason()
                                                             throws java.io.IOException
        Gets an array containing the people who wish to play in the league
        Returns:
        The array
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - An exception when reading from the text file

      • loadFixturesArray

        public static java.lang.String[][][] loadFixturesArray()
                                                throws java.lang.Exception
        Loads the fixtures array from the text file.
        Returns:
        The array of fixtures
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - An exception if the array can't be loaded due to the number of players being too small.

      • addPlayerToFixtures

        public static void addPlayerToFixtures(java.lang.String playerName,
                                       java.lang.String[] allClubMembers)
                                throws java.lang.Exception
        Adds a player who is not part of the fixtures already to the league. If no games have been played, the fixtures will be generated from scratch. Otherwise, they cannot actually play until a new season begins.
        Parameters:
        playerName - The player name
        allClubMembers - An array of all club member names (INCLUDING PLAYER TO BE ADDED)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - An exception may occur when reading and writing to text files

      • removePlayerFromFixtures

        public static void removePlayerFromFixtures(java.lang.String playerName)
                                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Checks to see if the player is part of the league (or waiting to be) and removes them if they are. If they appear in the fixtures, those games will be marked as bye games.
        Parameters:
        playerName - The name of the player
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - An exception may occur when reading to and from a text file
